Announcement 15 April, 14:48 CET
Dear Traders,
After a short maintenance break , the platform is back up for you to continue diving in to the last 24 hours within this third round.
Platform performance upgrades completed
Hardcoded algo submissions done during round 1 and 2 have been removed and the leaderboard and archipelago views have been regenerated to reflect updated scores.

Please be reminded hardcoding is not allowed and teams submitting such files from now on will be disqualified from Prosperity. 

Lastly, please check out the Wiki for a hint on the algorithmic challenge..
Announcement 14 April, 17:14 CET
Dear everyone,
As promised, we are sharing with you an update on the developments of the last day and answer some of the more pressing questions.
Hardcoding algo file uploads

As announced this morning, hardcoding your algorithmic trades based on recognized patterns of bot behavior is not allowed. Teams doing this from round 3 onwards will be disqualified including all users within that team. If we see users moving to different teams, those teams will be disqualified as well.

During round 1 and 2, there were some teams who hardcoded their algo files. We will be removing those files from the platform and update the leaderboard when we switch from Round 3 to Round 4, after which you will see the updated scores reflect. For those teams, we will be using a submission in round 1 and 2 that is not hardcoded. These teams have been reach out to individually to update them with above information.
Platform performance issues

At the end of round 2, we experienced platform performance issues leading to the submissions section being unavailable to some. Unfortunately, we will not be reopening round 2. If you have a submission ID that was previously run for round 2 which you would like to count as your final submission for round 2, kindly DM that submission ID along with team name to @jack (on Discord) so he can run that one as your final submission.

We are working hard to stabilize the platform so it is accessible for everyone. In addition to performance changes, we are making an update to the platform soon (before round 3 ends) allowing you to submit a one file at a time. You can only upload a new file once your previous file has stopped running (either accepted or rejected).
We apologize for any inconvenience regarding this matter.
Fake accounts and bot traffic
We have noticed fake accounts and bot traffic on the platform. We are working on removing those. Please note these do not have an affect on the distributions in manual round 2.
At the end of Prosperity, top teams eligible for prizes will be checked thoroughly, so creating fake emails and doing automated uploads will not get you far.
Scheduled Maintenance

Tomorrow (15 April) at 1PM CET, we will have a short scheduled maintenance where we will do some platform performance upgrades, as well as regenerate the leaderboard and archipelago to update the scores with hardcoded file submissions removed. This scheduled maintenance period is expected to last 1-2 hours maximum.
Behavior on Discord

We understand your frustration at certain situations. We are doing everything we can to make this a fun and fair experience for all of you. Please keep your behavior and language on Discord proper. We have a zero-tolerance policy and will remove you from Discord when we see inappropriate messages directed towards staff of IMC as well as fellow participants.

Of course, we do value constructive feedback and we always welcome this. Although we do not respond to everything, we do read your messages and take them into account. So thank you for your constructive feedback!
Announcement 14 April, 11:57 CET
Hi everyone,

Although a more extensive announcement will follow later today, we would already like to communicate that hardcoding algo submissions based on discovered trends in bot behavior is not allowed. IMC Prosperity stands for fair play and values skillsets and knowledge to write algorithms which could perform well in simulated real market conditions and not algorithms which exploits unfair advantage based on past participation or data leak or any form of look-ahead bias.

Effective start of round 3, any teams doing hardcoded submissions will be disqualified from Prosperity with immediate effect, including all players in those teams. When those players move to different teams, those teams will be disqualified as well. 

We will be taking retrospective action on teams that hardcoded their submissions during Round 2 so that those teams do not have an unfair disadvantage. We will send out more information about this later today.
Announcement 11 April, 17:10 CET
Hi all,
Data in a bottle for round 2 has been updated to reflect the updates we have done. Please make sure you refresh the browser so we are sure you are accessing the new file.
Announcement 11 April, 13:52 CET
Hello dear Traders,
We have good news to share!
We have replaced the Round 1 performance evaluation data with fresh price data for Day 1.
We have also fixed the problem causing the short simulation instead of the full simulation against 1M timestamps for some of you.

Along with addressing the two issues mentioned above, it was brought to our attention that RAINFOREST_RESIN trader bots are behaving identically to AMETHYSTS trader bots from Prosperity 2. We have addressed this issue as well, by making sure RAINFOREST_RESIN trader bots will behave in a fresh and new way starting from Round 1 evaluation.

Round 1 performance evaluation update is currently underway in order to reflect the above 3 updates, and you might see your scores being updated already on the platform. In a short while we will go into a brief maintenance mode (expected to last up to 1 hour) where all scores from Round 1 will be updated in the Leaderboard and on the Archipelago view.  Due to above changes to trader bot behavior and use of fresh pricing data for Round 1, we will also be updating the "Data in a Bottle" which will be reflected post maintenance break. 

Thank you for your efforts and helping us to ensure fair play in Prosperity 3.

Good luck with the rest of Round 2!
/end of announcement
Announcement 10 April, 18:04 CET
Unfortunately we encountered 2 errors in performing Round 1 Algorithmic trading challenge simulation for which we want to share an update. Please read carefully.
What happened?

Round 1 price data (Day 1) was mistakenly published in ‚ÄúData in a bottle‚Äù for a short period of time, causing some teams to gain an advantage by writing their algorithmic trades based on known Day 1 simulation data. The current scores in the leaderboard shows this unfair advantage.
Some teams only received simulation up to the first 100k timestamps instead of the complete 1M timestamps causing incomplete simulation seen in the scores on the leaderboard.
What will we do to resolve this?

We will use a fresh price data for Day_1 to evaluate Round 1 performance using your already uploaded algorithm scripts. No new submission for Round 1 will be allowed. The price data for Day -2, Day -1, and Day 0 on which you have based your trades when writing your scripts, will of course stay the same.

We will also fix the bug causing partial simulation and ensure running an entire simulation for all teams, so everyone‚Äôs last uploaded algo file will be evaluated based on the complete 1M timestamps.
When and how will this happen?

We will perform above changes during a short maintenance break during the current Round 2. We will let you know closer to the time we expect the platform to be down (this will at least not be in the next 16 hours). During this maintenance, we will update the leaderboard and Archipelago island with the new scores. You can continue making progress with Round 2 and find ideas to make more SeaShells trading the Picnic Baskets. 

We apologize for the inconvenience. We are working to ensure the gameplay is a fair and a pleasant experience for everyone and we appreciate all your efforts so far!

Please keep a look out at the ‚Å†announcements channel for more information on the upcoming maintenance mode.
/ End of announcement
